hobby.title: After work
hobby.brewing-description:
Brewing your own beer might seem as a complicating and demanding task. And that's exactly how it is... After a several dozen of batches, I still feel I barely starting exploring the hoppy world.

Regardless of results, I love experimenting with beer styles - planning, mashing and seeing to fermentation. It's not the same with sticking labels or cleaning the kitchen afterwards. But no pain, no gain...
hobby.squash-description:
To remain healthy, both physically and mentally, I simply must sweat a bit, from time to time.

I'm definitely not one of those, who can set their own challenges by going further or faster. I need an demanding opponent of flesh and blood on the other side of the court. Sometimes I win and sometimes I loose, but the most important part is this thrill between the first and last ball of the match.
hobby.traveling-description:
I won't be the first one to say it, but I love to travel. The further and more exotic my destination is - the better. And it's not only about the sights and architecture. I really enjoy observing peculiarities of all the different places and cultures.

And the most interesting are... markets. It's always the regular food shop, where you can clearly see the differences between countries - by the taste, scent and likes of the natives.
hobby.drumming-description:
Learning and practicing drums brings me immense joy. I won't claim I'm particularly good at it, but every session behind the kit is pure pleasure for me. It's a way to express myself and connect with my favorite music on a completely different level.

Even when I'm not playing any specific song, just practicing techniques and rhythms, I have a great time. It's meditation in motion that helps me disconnect from everyday life.

wasoft.name: WaSoft
wasoft.subtitle: Personal Website & API
wasoft.description:
A comprehensive full-stack personal portfolio application designed to showcase professional experience, skills, and projects in an interactive and engaging way. The project serves as both a digital resume and a demonstration of modern web development practices, featuring a responsive design that adapts seamlessly across all devices and screen sizes.

The front-end is built with React 18 and TypeScript, leveraging Vite for lightning-fast development experience and optimized production builds. It incorporates TailwindCSS for modern styling, custom animations for enhanced user experience, and i18next for complete multilingual support across three languages (English, Polish, and Silesian dialect). The application features smooth scrolling navigation, interactive floating cards with parallax effects, and a dedicated resume view with PDF generation capabilities.

The backend infrastructure is implemented as a serverless API using Azure Functions with C# and .NET 8. It provides a RESTful endpoint for the contact form, processing submissions and sending email notifications through SendGrid. This serverless architecture ensures cost-effectiveness, automatic scaling, and minimal maintenance overhead while maintaining high reliability and performance.

Both components are hosted on Azure cloud platform - the front-end on Azure Static Web Apps and the API on Azure Functions. The entire deployment process is fully automated through GitHub Actions, implementing a complete CI/CD pipeline that includes automated testing, building, and deployment triggered by code commits. This ensures rapid iteration cycles and consistent, reliable deployments to production.

poptokach.name: Po Ptokach
poptokach.subtitle: Interactive Wedding Invitation
poptokach.description:
A web application serving as a digital wedding invitation, presenting all logistical information in an accessible and visually attractive manner. The project addresses the challenge of managing two different guest groups (family and friends) using a single application and domain - differentiation occurs automatically based on URL prefixes (e.g., family.domain.pl vs. domain.pl), without needing to implement toggles in the interface.

The front-end is built with React 19 and TypeScript, using Vite for fast development environment. Styling is based on TailwindCSS 4, animations implemented with the Motion library, and UI components leverage shadcn/ui and Radix UI. Multilingual support in three languages (Polish, English, Silesian) is provided by i18next. The application offers responsive design, dynamic countdown to event date, smooth navigation between sections, and interactive animations.

Routing based on subdomains is handled on the client side - the application checks the hostname and automatically renders the appropriate content version. This solution allowed for handling two different 'business requirements' using a single project, one codebase, and one deployment. Hosting on Azure Static Web Apps ensures global availability and automatic SSL certificates.

wawrzelnia.name: Wawrzelnia
wawrzelnia.subtitle: Homebrewer's Portal
wawrzelnia.description:
A web application for cataloging and viewing homebrew beer batches along with process statistics. The front end, built with React 17 using TypeScript, MobX, and SCSS, provides simple navigation through the brewing history as well as previews of fermentation stages and a photo gallery.

The backend was rebuilt on Azure Functions (isolated, .NET 9) with HTTP functions for the batch list, statistics, versioning, and a contact form with a cooldown mechanism. Data is served from a lightweight SQLite database (read-only) via EF Core 8 and AutoMapper; logging is handled by Serilog, and emails are sent using MailKit. The solution is cost-optimized through a serverless architecture and a local file-based database.

about-me.title: About me
content: Solving complex technical problems that programming offers has always excited me. Figuring out the right algorithm and bringing it to life step by step gives me immense satisfaction.

However, building advanced systems is far more than just implementation. It involves conscious architectural choices, anticipating future requirements and potential bottlenecks. This requires deep understanding not only of technical aspects but also business goals and team constraints. Many people with diverse skills and perspectives must work in harmony to reach a common objective – and overseeing this process, identifying risks before they materialize, and supporting efficient team execution is as compelling to me as the code itself.
